intro: Lasianthera macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. Its fruits are large, dry, and three-angled, containing several seeds. Lasianthera macrocarpa is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
